item.title: Lorelei and the Laser Eyes coming to PS5, PS4 on December 3
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/lorelei-and-the-laser-eyes-coming-to-ps5-ps4-on-december-3

  • PS4
  • PS5

Currently available for Switch and PC.

Publisher Annapurna Interactive and developer Simogo will release puzzle game Lorelei and the Laser Eyes for PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 4 on December 3, the companies announced.

Lorelei and the Laser Eyes first launched for Switch and PC via Steam on May 16.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

The stage is set. Imagine an old baroque manor, perhaps a hotel or a museum, somewhere in central Europe. A woman wanders in search of answers.

An international auteur. What does he want? An aristocratic artist. Who killed her? A vagabond illusionist. Who is he?

And you, the wandering woman. Why are you here?

Watch carefully, observe. Numbers. Patterns. Puzzles. Are they all part of a macabre game, a complot, a simple treasure hunt?

We invite you to take a journey into the nightmarish surreality, and answer these questions to solve the enigma of Lorelei and the Laser Eyes—a non-linear adventure puzzle—no—place—yes—place.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: INDIE Live Expo: December 7, 2024 to showcase over 100 games, including multiple world premieres
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/indie-live-expo-december-7-2024-to-showcase-over-100-games-including-multiple-world-premieres

INDIE Live Expo Awards 2024 nominees also announced.

This winter’s INDIE Live Expo live digital showcase will air on December 7 at 2:00 a.m. PT / 5:00 a.m. ET / 19:00 JST, organizer Ryu’s Office announced. You will be able to watch it on YouTube (English, Japanese, Korean), Twitch (English, Japanese), Twitter (English, Japanese, Korean), and Steam.

The showcase will feature a lineup of over 100 titles, including updates on All in Abyss: Judge the Fake, Blade Chimera, Kemono Teatime, Marisa of Liartop Mountain, NOROI KAGO: the Grudged Domain, The Great Villainess: Strategy of Lily, and Yunyun Syndrome!? Rhythm Psychosis, multiple world premieres including the reveal of Sofia in Exchange for Lies, and many more titles.

The broadcast will feature three segments, each about an hour in length:

  • Indie Waves – The first segment brings high energy with 15-second videos of indie games from around the world on PC, console, and mobile, all in quick succession.
  • INDIE Spotlight – The INDIE Live Expo Executive Committee will introduce the hottest indie games across various genres. Stay tuned in for never-before-seen world premieres and the Publisher Selection, special segments dedicated to publishers supporting indie devs.
  • INDIE Live Expo Awards 2024 – The show will conclude with the INDIE Live Expo Awards 2024, which will present awards in various categories to outstanding indie games of the past year across four different categories.

The nominees for the INDIE Live Expo Awards 2024 are as follows:

  • Best Game Feel Award
    • COCOON (Geometric Interactive / Annapurna Interactive)
    • Thronefall (GrizzlyGames)
    • DREDGE (Black Salt Games, Team17)
  • Best New Characters Award
    • Slay the Princess (Black Tabby Games / Serenity Forge)
    • SANABI (WONDER POTION / NEOWIZ)
    • Goodbye Volcano High (KO_OP)
  • Rules of Play Award
    • Chants of Sennaar (Rundis / Focus Entertainment)
    • Balatro (LocalThunk / Playstack)
    • Luck be a Landlord (TrampolineTales)
  • Best Short Game Award
    • No Case Should Remain Unsolved (Somi)
    • clickyland (Sokpop Collective)
    • Animal Well (Shared Memory / BIGMODE)

item.title: YIIK: A Postmodern RPG update ‘YIIK I.V’ launches December 2
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/yiik-a-postmodern-rpg-update-yiik-i-v-launches-december-2

  • PC
  • PS4
  • Switch

New battle system, party members, and more in free update.

YIIK: A Postmodern RPG free update “YIIK I.V” will launch for PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC on December 2, publisher Ysbryd Games and developer Ackk Studios announced. It will add a new battle system, new party members, and more.

“We want to thank our supportive community for their patience as my brother Brian and I put our hearts and souls into the development of ‘I.V,'” said Ackk Studios co-founder and co-director Andrew Allanson in a press release. “We hope they find everything they’re looking for in the ultimate YIIK experience!”

Here is an overview of the update, via Ysbryd Games:

What should have been a happy homecoming becomes a collapse of reality as college graduate Alex is struck with a vision of a disappearing woman trapped in an iron maiden. Fueled by an obsession to reveal the truth, his investigation threatens to tear the boundaries of his world.

Meanwhile, The Nameless Child clings to the hope of reuniting with her long-lost brother as she trades her name for a party invitation. Recover the missing details of her past as she searches for a way to save both the Good Brother and the Bad Brother.

Experience Alex and The Nameless Child’s converging stories as they navigate an incomprehensible world of dangerous dreamlike dungeons riddled with intricate puzzles, deadly traps, and odd adversaries inspired by PlayStation 1 graphics.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Encounter peculiar allies along the descent into saturated, cryptic realms. Endure the unpredictable charisma of The Handsome Krow, hired to carry out plans for an upcoming guerrilla film. Meet method actress Asuka Furutani and decipher the line between performance and reality as the group encounters combat challenges like never before.

Battle bizarre entities in an arcane dance of turn-based combat. Be protected by mysterious beings known as Karta, which act as your first line of defense. Collect, strategize, and equip up to three Karta, each possessing distinct passive and active abilities and separate HP defenses. Engage in The Dark Game, a new battle system where you race against the flow of blood, balancing wounds and outlasting enemies.

Alongside extensive updates to YIIK‘s cast and combat system, “I.V” also offers additional and improved cutscenes, reimagined dungeon layouts, ten new areas, revamped Monster Dens to explore and power up, 150 new tracks, and an all-new leveling system within Alex’s Mind Dungeon: make great leaps in logic to uncover abilities, Karta, narrative secrets, and more.

YIIK: A Postmodern RPG is available now for PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam, GOG, Humble Store, and Microsoft Store.
